summary.name: Kindle Generation 7
summary.description: The Kindle Generation 7 is an e-reader that was released by Amazon in 2014. It is composed of a screen that uses e-ink, a lithium-ion battery, a motherboard, infrared LEDs, and an optical touch controller. This e-reader is an important media object because it was created by Amazon, a very powerful company today, and it has had to compete with many other e-readers, such as the Nook. The Kindle has gone through many different versions. The most recent model of the Kindle is the Kindle 11th Generation.

overview.name: E-Ink Corporation Headquarters
overview.description: This is a manufacturer of E-Ink. E-Ink Pearl is one of the versions of e Ink that the E Ink Corporation has created. This location is the listed headquarters for the E Ink Corporation.

overview.name: McNair Technology Co., Ltd
overview.description: This is the manufacturer I found for the lithium-ion battery that was in the specific Kindle that I analyzed. When searching for a location for the manufacturer, this was the main location that was mentioned.

location.address: McNair Industrial Estate, 1888 Meijing Rd West, Danglang Town, Dongguan, Guangdong

overview.name: Freescale Semiconductor Headquarters
overview.description: This is the headquarters for the manufacturing company, Freescale Semiconductor. For the Kindle that I analyzed, this was the manufacturer that was listed on iFixit.

overview.name: Qualcomm Atheros Headquarters
overview.description: This is the headquarters for the manufacturing company that creates a semiconductor in the Kindle that I analyzed.

location.address: 5480 Great America Parkway Santa Clara, CA

overview.name: Western Digital Corporation
overview.description: This is the company that is listed as a central manufacturer for the SanDisk flash memory card.

location.address: 5601 Great Oaks Parkway San Jose, CA 95119 USA

overview.name: Texas Instruments Incorporated Headquarters
overview.description: This is the headquarters listed for the designer and manufafturer for microcontroller for the LED lights on the Kindle that I looked at for the Assembly analysis.

overview.name: Neonode Inc.
overview.description: Neonode Inc. is the company responsible for manufacturig the infrared LEDs within the Kindle that I analyzed.

overview.name: Micron Technology Headquarters
overview.description: Micron Technology is a manufacturer that creates semiconductors. In the Kindle that I analyzed, the Mobile RAM was from this company.

overview.name: eBay Refurbished, seller: emb-phones
overview.description: Because the Kindle 7th Generation is an older model, the easiest place to find it is through online sellers. A lot of the e-readers have often been used by previous owners and need to be refurbished.

overview.name: Neonode Inc.
overview.description: Another part within the Kindle uses zForce tech, which is owned by Neonode Inc. This part is the single chip optical touch controller.

overview.name: Best Buy
overview.description: This is a retailer that sells different models of the Kindle. Because the model of Kindle that I am analyzing is an older model, ithe Kindles in stock here are newer models.

overview.name: Target
overview.description: This is a retailer that sells different models of the Kindle. Because the model of Kindle that I am analyzing is an older model, ithe Kindles in stock here are newer models.

overview.name: Foxconn
overview.description: This is where all Kindles are assembled.

location.address: New Taipei, No. 2, Zihyou St., Tucheng Dist, Taiwan
